intro: Buccaferrea cirrhosa, commonly known as the scarlet corymbia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Australia. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in dense, showy corymbs, attracting birds and insects. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy texture. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
